message.content:
cs.CV, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.HC, cs.MM

This paper deals with machine learning approaches used in medical imaging, specifically in object segmentation. It proposes a novel framework that reduces the annotation burden by allowing annotators to observe the object to segment and record where they have looked at with an eye gaze tracker. This suggests that the paper is likely to belong to the Computer Vision (cs.CV) sub-category. Additionally, the paper proposes a novel Expected Exponential loss function for semi-supervised learning, which indicates that it could also belong to the Machine Learning (cs.LG) and Artificial Intelligence (cs.AI) sub-categories. The use of an eye gaze tracker also suggests that the paper could be relevant to the Human-Computer Interaction (cs.HC) sub-category. Finally, the paper deals with video and 3D volumes, which could make it relevant to the Multimedia (cs.MM) sub-category.
